abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column examines why immigrants to United States have been found to integrate more successfully than their counterparts in Europe, in light of relatively hostile policies US has toward immigrant population; underscores importance of understanding America's traditionally more open approach to immigrants as presidential candidates like Donald Trump call for bigoted immigration policies.
lead_paragraph: While its policies are often hostile, the United States is more successful than Europe at integrating immigrants into the national fabric.

headline.main: For Immigrants, America Is Still More Welcoming Than Europe
headline.print_headline: Immigrants Still Find a Welcome in America

snippet: While its policies are often hostile, the United States is more successful than Europe at integrating immigrants into the national fabric....
